column6: Values, principles, standards, and norms of behavior
column13: Vicinity has zero tolerance for bribery or corruption in all aspects of its business. It applies to acts committed by Team Members or parties with whom Vicinity deals, for example, tenants, suppliers, external contractors and government authorities. Vicinity has a moral and ethical duty to act with the highest standards of integrity and honesty.\t

The purpose and scope of the Code of Conduct (the Code) is to support Vicinity's values and behaviours by ensuring appropriate standards of ethical and legal behaviour are maintained by Vicinity's Directors, Executive Committee (EC), team members and contractors directly engaged by Vicinity (together Team Members). Vicinity is committed to the highest integrity and ethical standards in all business practices. The Code outlines how Vicinity expects its Team Members to behave and conduct business in the workplace and with stakeholders outside our organisation.

column13: Whistleblowers can remain anonymous while disclosing, throughout and after the investigation is finalised. Their identity will only be revealed if the Whistleblower consents to its disclosure or if there is a legal or regulatory requirement to uncover it. In that case, Vicinity will ensure that only a de-identified report not identifying the Whistleblower is disclosed.

column7: Stakeholders, Board of Directors, RCESGC, Audit Committee, CEO, Executive Leadership Team, Sustainability Team, Sustainability Working Groups

The Board of Directors is responsible for demonstrating leadership, providing strategic direction, and overseeing the effective management and performance of Vicinity on behalf of Vicinity's securityholders. Risk, Compliance and ESG Committee (RCESGC) Oversees Vicinity's risk and compliance management. The Audit Committee Oversees financial governance and risks and the integrity of financial reporting and internal control processes. Chief Executive Officer Responsible for the day-to-day management of Vicinity and implementation of Vicinity's strategic objectives. The Executive Leadership Team (ELT) is Responsible for running Vicinity's operations and delivering Vicinity's strategic goals with the CEO. Sustainability Team Operating across the business, responsible for developing sustainability strategy and supporting the industry to achieve sustainability targets. Monitors and reports on activities. Provides strategic advice to the Board, CEO, RCESGC and ELT. Sustainability Working Groups Cross-business working groups are tasked with implementing the strategic pillars of the sustainability strategy. Reports to the ELT via the Sustainability Team. A key business representative leads each working group.
